item.title: Log Aggregation, Correlation and Visualization
item.description:
Log Aggregation link

Log Aggregation enables centralized collection of logs from servers, endpoints, applications, and network devices into a single platform. This eliminates log silos and provides a unified security view.

Event Correlation link

Correlation analyzes events across multiple sources to identify patterns that would be missed when logs are reviewed individually (e.g., repeated failed logins followed by a successful login from the same host). This significantly improves threat detection accuracy.

item.title: Case Management
item.description:
Case Management (TheHive) link

Case management is a critical component of the iSIEM platform that ensures security incidents are handled in a structured, consistent, and auditable manner. In iSIEM, case management is implemented using TheHive, an open-source incident response platform designed to support real-world security operations.

For SMEs, case management bridges the gap between detection and response, turning security alerts into clearly tracked incidents with ownership, context, and resolution.

item.title: SOAR
item.description:
Security Orchestration, Automation, and Response (SOAR â€“ Shuffle) link

The SOAR component of the iSIEM platform is implemented using Shuffle, an open-source security orchestration and automation tool. SOAR plays a critical role in transforming security monitoring from a reactive, manual process into a coordinated, automated, and repeatable response capability.

For SMEs, where security teams are small and resources are limited, SOAR enables faster and more consistent incident response without requiring a full-scale Security Operations Center (SOC).

item.title: AI Assistant
item.description:
AI Assistant (Ollama) link

The AI Assistant component of the iSIEM platform is implemented using Ollama, a local, self-hosted AI framework. Its primary purpose is to enhance security analysis and decision-making by transforming complex security alerts and raw technical data into clear, human-readable insights.

In SME environments, security teams are often small, time-constrained, and may lack deep specialization in every security domain. The AI Assistant addresses this gap by acting as an analytical support layer rather than a replacement for human analysts.
